newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian metals steady on low industrial demand.
newsitem.headline: Indian metals steady on low industrial demand.

text.p: Indian base metals on Friday remained steady at a higher level with demand from industrial consumers being sluggish, dealers said.
Scattered arrivals and a firm world market kept local prices at a previous level amid limited offerings, they said.

Copper was steady at 13,600 rupees per quintal, zinc at 7,950 rupees and lead at 4,150 rupees per quintal on limited activity. Tin was steady at the improved level of 31,400 rupees per quintal after gaining 200 rupees on Thursday while nickel was steady at 37,200 rupees per quintal after a rise of 300 rupees on Thursday.

"The market was agog with rumours on Thursday that the Indian government may hike import duty on tin and nickel by 10 percent but so far no such announcement has been made," said Sharad Parikh, president of Bombay Metal Exchange.

"Overall sentiments remained subdued at the close amid limited physical buying but looking at the upsurge in the world prices, local market may bounce back on fresh buying," Parikh said. -- Bombay Commodities +91-22-265 9000
